greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. satisfies: A(x) = 1 + x/A(-x)^4.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: G.f. satisfies: A(x) = G(x/A(x)^4) where G(x) = A(x*G(x)^4) is the g.f. of A213336.
G.f. satisfies: A(x) = ( x/Series_Reversion( x*F(x/(1-x)^4)^4 ) )^(1/4) where F(x) = 1 + x*F(x)^4 is the g.f. of A002293.
example: The g.f. G(x) of A213336 begins:
where G(x) = A(x*G(x)^4) and G(x/A(x)^4) = A(x);
also, G(x) = F(x/(1-x)^4) where F(x) = 1 + x*F(x)^4 is g.f. of A002293:
program: (PARI) {a(n)=local(A=1+x); for(i=1, n, A=1+x/subst(A^4, x, -x+x*O(x^n))); polcoeff(A, n)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 09 2012
